trigger: Inhibition of transcription factors led to reduced <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels

Pharmacological inhibitors were used to demonstrate that the transcription factor sites within the <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter are relevant for the induction of <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by GP .

As expected , an inhibition of NFkappaB via CAPE [ 35 ] and CyA , <extra_id_0> NFAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> via CyA and <extra_id_0> NFIL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> via CHX [ 36 ] could not be overruled by GP , leading to a down-regulated binding activity of the transcription factors to the <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> sites , and a reduction of <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA and <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein levels ( Fig . 7 ) .
The extent of reduction in NFATP2 / 3 binding is exemplarily shown in an autoradiogram ( Fig . 7A , left side ) and graphically summarized ( n = 4 , Fig . 7A , right side ) .
The results for the NFkappaB and NFIL-6 binding sites were similar ( data not shown ) .
Because the highest <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> amount was found at 24 h , mRNA was examined following 1 h inhibition and 18 h of GP .
A representative gel demonstrating a decrease in <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA after inhibition with CAPE , CyA and CHX is displayed in Fig . 7B ( n = 4 ) .
In addition , corresponding <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein levels after 24 h of GP are shown in Fig . 7C ( n = 3 ) .

Altogether , NFkappaB inhibition by CAPE was more pronounced at the binding activity and the transcription , whereas CyA and CHX mainly led to a decreased <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> release .
